articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel has questioned the impartiality of an International Criminal Court judge appointed to a panel deciding whether an arrest warrant should be issued for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
articles.title: Israel questions ICC judge's impartiality in Netanyahu arrest case

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: President Joe Biden will host President-elect Donald Trump at the White House on Wednesday for a meeting designed to demonstrate a smooth transition between administrations despite Trump's team not yet having signed documents to start the handover process.
articles.title: Biden, Trump to meet at White House for transition talks after Harris defeat

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel launched a major air and ground offensive against the Iran-backed group Hezbollah in late September.
articles.title: Lebanon awaits truce proposals after US envoy expresses hope

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces deepened their incursion into Beit Hanoun town in the north, forcing most remaining residents to leave.
articles.title: Israeli forces kill 14 people in Gaza, force new displacement in the north

articles.author: David Kirton, Nicoco Chan
articles.description: The attack happened as Zhuhai captured China’s attention with the largest aviation exhibition.
articles.title: Zhuhai car attack: China clears memorial as government scrambles to respond

articles.author: Muvija M
articles.description: The Church of England faced pressure on Wednesday to ensure people are held to account for systematically covering up allegations of abuse, one day after the Archbishop of Canterbury resigned over a church abuse scandal.
articles.title: Church of England faces pressure over abuse scandal after Archbishop quits

articles.author: Michael Gore, Vincent West, Jon Nazca
articles.description: Spaniards braced for further heavy rain and storms on Wednesday, just two weeks after rain and flash floods prompted rivers to overflow in Valencia and other parts of Spain, killing more than 200 people and destroying homes and property.
articles.title: Spaniards brace for fresh storms two weeks after deadly Valencia floods

articles.author: Gabriel Stargardter
articles.description: French authorities have stepped up security in Paris ahead of a France-Israel soccer match on Thursday, hoping to avoid a repeat of violent clashes between locals and Israeli soccer fans in Amsterdam last week.
articles.title: France tightens security for Israel soccer match after clashes in Amsterdam

articles.author: Luiza Ilie
articles.description: The United States is concerned by Russia's growing relationship with North Korea and by what technology the two countries may be exchanging, the top U.S. arms control official said on Wednesday.
articles.title: US concerned by Russia-North Korea ties and technology exchanges

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: A U.S. government employee has been indicted for leaking classified national defense information, according to federal court records unsealed on Wednesday.
articles.title: US indicts suspected leaker of classified documents on Israel's plans to strike Iran
